meanings.sent1: He chinsed his friend by taking his lunch money.
meanings.sent2: The con artist chinsed many people out of their savings.
meanings.sent3: The tricky fox chinsed the clever rabbit in a game of wits.
meanings.sent4: She chinsed her way to the top by deceiving her competitors.
meanings.sent5: The dishonest salesman chinsed customers with false promises.

meanings.definition: To cut or trim with scissors
meanings.sent1: She chinsed the paper to make a snowflake.
meanings.sent2: The tailor chinsed the fabric to create a perfect fit.
meanings.sent3: The barber accidentally chinsed off more hair than intended.
meanings.sent4: He chinsed the bushes into animal shapes for the garden.
meanings.sent5: The student carefully chinsed the construction paper for the art project.

meanings.definition: To reduce in size or amount
meanings.sent1: They chinsed the budget to save money for the trip.
meanings.sent2: The chef chinsed the recipe to make it healthier.
meanings.sent3: The magician chinsed the scarf, making it disappear in a puff of smoke.
meanings.sent4: The editor chinsed the article to fit the word limit.
meanings.sent5: She chinsed her wardrobe, donating clothes she no longer wore.
